page.title: 03The Uckfield By-pass.
page.content: The{by-pass}is part of the 8km {Uckfield by-pass}built to reduce the amount of traffic through Uckfield.It begins at the A26 north of Five Ash Down and goes south-west to a roundabout south of Maresfield at Budletts Common and leaves our block at BlackDown.Work began in January 1984 and will be{finished in March {1986}.There are 4 gangs of 3 men working on the section south of Maresfield.They are using lorries excavators rollers cranes diggers and Land Rovers.The men work 12 hours a day.They are digging out soil and sandstone.The foundation of the road is hardcore and granite chips then dry ballast and cement which is rolled.When it is finished all through traffic to the south coast will miss Uckfield and stop the traffic jams by Daniel, John, Simon.
